benchmark_details.name: BELB (Biomedical Entity Linking Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: BELB provides access in a unified format to 11 corpora linked to 7 knowledge bases and spanning six entity types: gene, disease, chemical, species, cell line and variant. It serves as a standardized testbed for reproducible experiments in the biomedical entity linking task.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To standardize experimental setups for biomedical entity linking and facilitate research by providing a common benchmark.

data.source: 11 corpora linked to 7 knowledge bases including specialized databases for various biomedical entities.
data.annotation: Extensive data cleaning and normalization to ensure consistency.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of predictions against gold standard mentions.
methodology.interpretation: Results indicate the model's ability to correctly identify and link entity mentions to their corresponding entities in the knowledge base.
methodology.baseline_results: Multiple baseline models were evaluated including both rule-based and neural approaches.
methodology.validation: Validation against extensive benchmarked test sets.
